item.title: Chapter One
item.description:
Chapter One#

Translation by Bhikkhu Sujato.

1.1 Subhūti#

My little hut is roofed and pleasant,
Sheltered from the wind:
So rain, sky, as you please!
My mind is serene and freed,
I practice whole-heartedly: so rain, sky!

1.2 Mahākoṭṭhika#

Calm and quiet, Wise in counsel and steady; Shaking off bad qualities, As the wind shakes leaves off a tree.

1.3 Kaṅkhārevata#

See this wisdom of the Tathāgatas! Like a fire blazing in the night, Giving light, giving vision, Dispelling the doubt of those who’ve come here.
